intro: Arytera lineosquamulata, commonly known as the linear-squamulate arytera, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, linear leaves with a scaly texture. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
